chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof starting with "```coq
", ending with "Qed.```", without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```coq
simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```coq
intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Solve This Proof State:

Hypotheses:
G: AbelianGroup
n: nat
m: nat

Goal:
forall A B : matrix m n, Mplus A B = Mplus B A

Premises:
matrix = fun (T : Type) (m n : nat) => Tn m (Tn n T) : Type -> nat -> nat -> Type Argument T is implicit and maximally inserted Argument scopes are [type_scope nat_scope nat_scope]
Mplus = fun A B : matrix m n => mk_matrix m n (fun i j : nat => plus (coeff_mat zero A i j) (coeff_mat zero B i j)) : matrix m n -> matrix m n -> matrix m n
Inductive GFormula (TA TX AA AF : Type) : Type := TT : Tauto.GFormula | FF : Tauto.GFormula | X : TX -> Tauto.GFormula | A : TA -> AA -> Tauto.GFormula | Cj : Tauto.GFormula -> Tauto.GFormula -> Tauto.GFormula | D : Tauto.GFormula -> Tauto.GFormula -> Tauto.GFormula | N : Tauto.GFormula -> Tauto.GFormula | I : Tauto.GFormula -> option AF -> Tauto.GFormula -> Tauto.GFormula For GFormula: Arguments TA, TX, AA, AF are implicit and maximally inserted For TT: Arguments TA, TX, AA, AF are implicit and maximally inserted For FF: Arguments TA, TX, AA, AF are implicit and maximally inserted For X: Arguments TA, TX, AA, AF are implicit and maximally inserted For A: Arguments TA, TX, AA, AF are implicit and maximally inserted For Cj: Arguments TA
fst = fun (A B : Type) (p : A * B) => let (x, _) := p in x : forall A B : Type, A * B -> A Arguments A, B are implicit and maximally inserted Argument scopes are [type_scope type_scope _]
snd = fun (A B : Type) (p : A * B) => let (_, y) := p in y : forall A B : Type, A * B -> B Arguments A, B are implicit and maximally inserted Argument scopes are [type_scope type_scope _]
Inductive prod (A B : Type) : Type := pair : A -> B -> A * B For pair: Arguments A, B are implicit and maximally inserted For prod: Argument scopes are [type_scope type_scope] For pair: Argument scopes are [type_scope type_scope _ _]
Inductive sumbool (A B : Prop) : Set := left : A -> {A} + {B} | right : B -> {A} + {B} For left, when applied to no more than 1 argument: Arguments A, B are implicit and maximally inserted For left, when applied to 2 arguments: Argument A is implicit For right, when applied to no more than 1 argument: Arguments A, B are implicit and maximally inserted For right, when applied to 2 arguments: Argument B is implicit For sumbool: Argument scopes are [type_scope type_scope] For left: Argument scopes are [type_scope type_scope _] For right: Argument scopes are [type_scope type_scope _]
Mopp = fun A : matrix m n => mk_matrix m n (fun i j : nat => opp (coeff_mat zero A i j)) : matrix m n -> matrix m n
Inductive list (A : Type) : Type := nil : list A | cons : A -> list A -> list A For nil: Arguments are renamed to T For cons: Arguments are renamed to T, x, s For nil: Argument T is implicit and maximally inserted For cons: Argument T is implicit and maximally inserted For list: Argument scope is [type_scope] For nil: Argument scope is [type_scope] For cons: Argument scopes are [type_scope _ seq_scope]
mk_matrix_bij : forall (x0 : ?T) (A : matrix ?m ?n), mk_matrix ?m ?n (coeff_mat x0 A) = A where ?T : [G : AbelianGroup m : nat n : nat |- Type] ?m : [G : AbelianGroup m : nat n : nat |- nat] ?n : [G : AbelianGroup m : nat n : nat |- nat]
coeff_mat = fun (T : Type) (m n : nat) (x0 : T) (A : matrix m n) (i j : nat) => coeff_Tn x0 (coeff_Tn (mk_Tn n (fun _ : nat => x0)) A i) j : forall (T : Type) (m n : nat), T -> matrix m n -> nat -> nat -> T Arguments T, m, n are implicit and maximally inserted Argument scopes are [type_scope nat_scope nat_scope _ _ nat_scope nat_scope]
list_ind : forall (A : Type) (P : list A -> Prop), P Datatypes.nil -> (forall (a : A) (l : list A), P l -> P (a :: l)%list) -> forall l : list A, P l
Mzero = mk_matrix m n (fun _ _ : nat => zero) : matrix m n
mk_matrix : forall m0 n0 : nat, (nat -> nat -> ?T) -> matrix m0 n0 where ?T : [G : AbelianGroup m : nat n : nat |- Type]
coeff_mat_ext : forall (x0 : ?T) (v1 v2 : matrix ?m ?n), v1 = v2 < -> (forall i j : nat, coeff_mat x0 v1 i j = coeff_mat x0 v2 i j) where ?T : [G : AbelianGroup m : nat n : nat |- Type] ?m : [G : AbelianGroup m : nat n : nat |- nat] ?n : [G : AbelianGroup m : nat n : nat |- nat]
coeff_mat_ext_aux : forall (x1 x2 : ?T) (v1 v2 : matrix ?m ?n), v1 = v2 < -> (forall i j : nat, (i < ?m)%nat -> (j < ?n)%nat -> coeff_mat x1 v1 i j = coeff_mat x2 v2 i j) where ?T : [G : AbelianGroup m : nat n : nat |- Type] ?m : [G : AbelianGroup m : nat n : nat |- nat] ?n : [G : AbelianGroup m : nat n : nat |- nat]
ssrnat.mul2n : forall m : nat, ssrnat.muln 2 m = ssrnat.double m
Nat.mul_id_l : forall n m : nat, m <> 0%nat -> (n * m)%nat = m < -> n = 1%nat
Nat.mul_cancel_r : forall n m p : nat, p <> 0%nat -> (n * p)%nat = (m * p)%nat < -> n = m
Nat.mul_0_l : forall n : nat, (0 * n)%nat = 0%nat
Rmult_1_l : forall r : R, 1 * r = r
Nat.mul_1_l : forall n : nat, (1 * n)%nat = n
Nat.add_0_l : forall n : nat, (0 + n)%nat = n
Nat.mul_0_r : forall n : nat, (n * 0)%nat = 0%nat
plus_reg_r : forall r x y : ?G, plus x r = plus y r -> x = y where ?G : [G : AbelianGroup m : nat n : nat |- AbelianGroup]
plus_reg_l : forall r x y : ?G, plus r x = plus r y -> x = y where ?G : [G : AbelianGroup m : nat n : nat |- AbelianGroup]
Nat.mul_succ_r : forall n m : nat, (n * S m)%nat = (n * m + n)%nat
Nat.mul_succ_l : forall n m : nat, (S n * m)%nat = (n * m + m)%nat
Nat.add_1_l : forall n : nat, (1 + n)%nat = S n
Nat.max_spec_le : forall n m : nat, (n <= m)%nat /\ Nat.max n m = m \/ (m <= n)%nat /\ Nat.max n m = n
Nat.max_spec : forall n m : nat, (n < m)%nat /\ Nat.max n m = m \/ (m <= n)%nat /\ Nat.max n m = n
Record mixin_of (K : AbelianGroup) : Type := Mixin { mult : K -> K -> K; one : AbelianGroup.sort K; ax1 : forall x y z : K, mult x (mult y z) = mult (mult x y) z; ax2 : forall x : K, mult x one = x; ax3 : forall x : K, mult one x = x; ax4 : forall x y z : K, mult (plus x y) z = plus (mult x z) (mult y z); ax5 : forall x y z : K, mult x (plus y z) = plus (mult x y) (mult x z) } For Mixin: Argument scopes are [_ function_scope _ function_scope function_scope function_scope function_scope function_scope]
iter_nat_point : forall (op : ?T -> ?T -> ?T) (x0 : ?T), (forall x : ?T, op x x0 = x) -> forall (a : nat -> ?T) (n0 : nat), iter_nat op x0 a n0 n0 = a n0 where ?T : [G : AbelianGroup m : nat n : nat |- Type]

```coq
intros A B.
unfold Mplus.
f_equal.
apply functional_extensionality.
intros i.
apply functional_extensionality.
intros j.
rewrite <- plus_assoc.
f_equal.
Qed.
```
